context.name: XSP_CLI
context.description: This is the server root context.

context.name: Applications
context.description: This level is used to view and modify applications entries.

context.name: BroadworksDms
context.description: This level is used to configure Device Management attributes.

context.name: Cache
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the configuration of the cache.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the cache related configuration.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the cache related configuration.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Attributes to include through the set command.

parameter.name: timeToLiveInHours
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time-to-live in the cache, in hours.

parameter.name: entryCapacity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of elements allowed in the cache.

parameter.name: byteCapacityInMBytes
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size of the cache, in megabytes.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear cache related configuration.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the attribute to be cleared.

context.name: DiskCipher
context.description: This level is used to view and set disk cipher-related attributes.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the disk cipher general settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view disk cipher-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify disk cipher-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: encryptionType
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the encryption type used by the encryption module.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear disk cipher-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

command.name: changeCipherKey
command.description: This command is used to change the disk cipher key for the current encryption type.

context.name: DedicatedRepository
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the configuration of the dedicated repository.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the dedicated repository related configuration.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the dedicated repository related configuration.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Attributes to include through the set command.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: When set to true, matching requests are forwarded to the dedicated repository.

parameter.name: requestType
parameter.description: The type of request using the dedicated repository.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: The IP address or FQDN of the dedicated repository.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port used by the dedicated repository.

parameter.name: rootDirectory
parameter.description: The root directory on the dedicated repository.

parameter.name: secure
parameter.description: When set to true, use TLS to communicate with the dedicated repository.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: Username passed to the dedicated repository in response to an HTTP basic or digest challenge.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear the dedicated repository related configuration.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Attributes to include through the clear command.

parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging on and off.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default logging severity level.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the priority of the logging thread. The value "1" indicates the lowest priority and "5" indicates the highest.

parameter.name: maxQueueSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size of the logging queue.

parameter.name: showThreadName
parameter.description: This parameter enables thread name logging.

context.name: WebBranding
context.description: This level is used to view and modify web branding for CommPilot-XS-TAS. In a CommPilot-XS-TAS Web Server farm, servers are identified as web branding masters (recommended two servers). Each time an administrator accesses a Web Branding administration page, the administrator is automatically redirected to a branding master.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Web Branding configuration for the CommPilot-XS-TAS application.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Web Branding-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: master
parameter.description: Indicate if the CommPilot-XS-TAS portal is a branding master or slave.

parameter.name: masterFqdn
parameter.description: Specifies the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the branding master. For example, xsp1.mtl.broadsoft.com.

parameter.name: slaveFqdn
parameter.description: Specifies the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the branding slave. For example, xsp2.mtl.broadsoft.com.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear Web Branding-related attributes.

context.name: DeviceManagementTFTP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) program attributes. This program acts as a bridge between the TFTP program and the Device Management servlet running in Tomcat. Files transferred from devices using get and put commands are never stored on the disk on the Xtended Services Platform. The content of the files are streamed between the Profile Server and the device through the Device Management servlet and the TFTP application. This application runs as root since it needs to listen on the TFTP port (69).

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, and clear the Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view General Settings-related attributes in the system.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify General Settings-related attributes in the system.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies the queues to be modified.

parameter.name: serverPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server port.

parameter.name: clientPortLow
parameter.description: The minimum value of the range of UDP ports that can be used to respond to TFTP requests.

parameter.name: clientPortHigh
parameter.description: The maximum value of the range of UDP ports that can be used to respond to TFTP requests.

parameter.name: deviceAccessContextName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the device access context name.

parameter.name: deviceAccessUri
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) configured on the Application Server for the devices to use to retrieve configuration files.

parameter.name: maxActiveTransfers
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of simultaneous Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) file transfers.

parameter.name: symmetricTftp
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether symmetric TFTP is enabled on the system. When enabled, the TFTP server port will be used to respond to request.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear General Settings-related attributes in the system.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Clears the URI configured on the Application Server that the device uses to retrieve a file in the system.

context.name: MaxActiveTransferThreshold
context.description: This parameter specifies the max active transfer limits which control alarm generation.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the max active transfer threshold settings.

command.name: set
command.description: The command is used to modify the max active transfer threshold settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a threshold is active.

parameter.name: armValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for enabling a threshold crossing.

parameter.name: resetValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for clearing a threshold crossing.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter enables or disables data collection for JVM statistics.

parameter.name: statisticsRefreshPeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the frequency at which BroadWorks fetches PMs from JVM Mbeans.

context.name: OCSConnectivity
context.description: This level is used to configure the connection between the Open Client Interface (OCI) over Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) application with the local Open Client Server (OCS).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Open Client Server (OCS) connectivity-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Open Client Server (OCS) connectivity-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: Sets the host where the OCS is running.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: Sets the port on OCS that web service will connect to.

parameter.name: maxNumberOfOCIPConnections
parameter.description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneous connections to OCS for OCI-P.

parameter.name: maxNumberOfCAPConnections
parameter.description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneous connections to OCS for CAP.

parameter.name: retryInitializationIntervalInSeconds
parameter.description: Sets the number of seconds to wait before rebuilding connection to OCS.

parameter.name: waitTimeoutIntervalInSeconds
parameter.description: Sets the number of seconds to wait before timing out a response from OCS.

context.description: This level is used to view and modify Open Client Server (OCS)-related attributes. The Network Server and Application Server clusters communicate with the Open Client Server.

context.name: CAPProxy
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Client Application Protocol (CAP) proxy entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view CAPProxy-related attributes in the system.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to set CAPProxy-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter controls the Client Application Protocol (CAP) proxy.

parameter.name: serverPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Client Application Protocol (CAP) port for the Application Servers in the cluster.

parameter.name: numConnections
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of permanent Client Application Protocol (CAP) connections to the Application Server.

context.name: ExternalAuthentication
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, and clear external authentication entries.

context.name: AccessControlList
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, delete, and clear the Access Control List (ACL) entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view External Authentication ACL entries in the system.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new External Authentication ACL entry in the system.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the host.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the Access Control List (ACL) entry.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify an External Authentication ACL entry in the system.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the host.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the Access Control List (ACL) entry.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing External Authentication ACL entry from the system.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the host.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear External Authentication ACL-related attributes in the system.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the host.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be cleared.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, and clear the general settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Open Client Server (OCS) general settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Open Client Server (OCS) general settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: systemDomain
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the domain to append to the user IDs in requests.

parameter.name: clientPortEnabled
parameter.description: This parameter controls the use of an unsecure Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port.

parameter.name: clientPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the unsecure Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) listening port.

parameter.name: secureClientPortEnabled
parameter.description: This parameter enables the use of a secure Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port.

parameter.name: secureClientPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the secure Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) listening port.

parameter.name: enableCallCorrelationID
parameter.description: This parameter controls the presence of call correlation information in the application logs.

parameter.name: disconnectOnInvalidSession
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether an error is sent to the user using an invalid session ID or the connection is simply dropped.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear General Setting-related attributes in the system.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be cleared.

context.name: JVMStatsCollector
context.description: This level is used to configure the Open Client Server (OCS) Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector settings.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to configure the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

command.name: set
command.description: The command is used to modify the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter enables or disables data collection for JVM statistics.

parameter.name: statisticsRefreshPeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the frequency at which BroadWorks fetches PMs from JVM Mbeans.

context.name: HeapUsageThreshold
context.description: This level is used to configure the heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the heap usage threshold settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a threshold is active.

parameter.name: armValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for enabling a threshold crossing.

parameter.name: resetValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for clearing a threshold crossing.

context.name: NonHeapUsageThreshold
context.description: This level is used to configure the non-heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the non-heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the non-heap usage threshold settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a threshold is active.

parameter.name: armValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for enabling a threshold crossing.

parameter.name: resetValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for clearing a threshold crossing.

context.name: Logging
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the logging for the Open Client Server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view logging-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify logging-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging on and off.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default logging severity level.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the priority of the logging thread. The value "1" indicates the lowest priority and "5" indicates the highest.

parameter.name: maxQueueSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size of the logging queue.

parameter.name: showThreadName
parameter.description: This parameter enables thread name logging.

context.name: InputChannels
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, or clear input channels entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view input channels-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify input channels-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the logging input channel.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging to the logging input channel on and off.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the severity level of the logging input channel.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear input channels-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the logging input channel.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to clear.

context.name: OutputChannels
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, or clear output channels.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view output channels-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify output channels-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the logging output channel.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging to the logging output channel on and off.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the directory where the log files are located.

parameter.name: filePrefix
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the prefix of the log files.

parameter.name: fileSizeInMB
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size of a log file.

parameter.name: numberOfFiles
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of log files that exist before the old log files are deleted.

context.name: NSOCIProxy
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, and add Network Server Open Client Interface (OCI) proxy entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view NSOCIProxy-related attributes in the system.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify NSOCIProxy-related attributes in the system.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter controls the Network Server Open Client Interface (OCI) proxy.

parameter.name: commonCommunicationTransportNSPSPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Open Client Interface (OCI) listening port on the Network Server.

parameter.name: useSecureSockets
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the Open Client Interface (OCI) listening port on the Network Server is a secure port.

parameter.name: messageQueueCapacity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum capacity of the message queue.

parameter.name: messageQueueTimeoutSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time-out (in seconds) for the message queue.

context.name: NameService
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Name service settings. The Naming service defines the interaction of the application with a Domain Name System (DNS) or local naming solution.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Name service-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Name service-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: cachePolicy
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Cache policy. When this parameter value is set to "HONOR_DNS", the Domain Name System (DNS) client uses the response's ''Time To Live'' (TTL) value.

parameter.name: cacheTTLSecs
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time (in seconds) a successfully looked-up record is cached if the Cache policy is set to "Configured".

parameter.name: negativeCachePolicy
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the negative Cache policy. When this parameter value is set to "HONOR_DNS", the Domain Name System (DNS) client uses the minimum value of the response's Start of Authority (SOA) record.

parameter.name: negativeCacheTTLSecs
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time (in seconds) a looked-up record with a negative response is kept in the negative cache if the negative Cache policy is set to "Configured".

parameter.name: unreachableServerLingerSecs
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum time interval (in seconds) during which no Domain Name System (DNS) request is sent to a server that is detected as unreachable.

parameter.name: useAdditionalSrvRrs
parameter.description: This parameter controls the use of additional Resource Record (RR) sections of the Service Locator (SRV) lookup response. When the value is set to "true", it indicates that an A lookup resulting from SRV lookups uses the pre-resolved A resource records from the additional RR section of the SRV lookup response. Local caching must be enabled for this setting to have an effect.

context.name: OCIProxy
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Open Client Interface (OCI) proxy settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Open Client Interface (OCI) proxy-related attributes in the system.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Open Client Interface (OCI) proxy-related attributes in the system.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter controls the Open Client Interface (OCI) proxy.

parameter.name: enableLoginLevelScreening
parameter.description: This parameter controls message filtering based on a defined list of allowed login levels.

parameter.name: enableResponseCaching
parameter.description: This parameter controls caching of Open Client Interface (OCI) responses.

parameter.name: responseCacheDurationHours
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the duration (in hours) of a cached Open Client Interface (OCI) response.

parameter.name: responseCacheRenewPeriodMins
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the extension to the duration of Open Client Interface (OCI) responses (in minutes). During this period, values found in the cache are considered valid, but trigger a refresh of the cache.

parameter.name: messageQueueCapacity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum capacity of the message queue.

parameter.name: messageQueueTimeoutSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time-out (in seconds) for the message queue.

context.name: LoginLevelAllowed
context.description: This level is used to view, add, and delete the login level allowed entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the login level allowed entries.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a login level allowed entry.

parameter.name: loginLevel
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the selected login level.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a login level allowed entry.

parameter.name: loginLevel
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the selected login level.

context.name: ResponseCache
context.description: This level is used to view, add, or delete Open Client Interface (OCI) response cache entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) response cache entries.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) response cache entry.

parameter.name: requestName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) request that has a response that needs to be cached.

parameter.name: responseName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) response that needs to be cached.

parameter.name: minResponseLengthBytes
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum size of the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) response that is cached (in bytes). Any request smaller than this number will not be cached. This prevents the Open Client Server from caching numerous small Open Client Interface (OCI) responses.

parameter.name: enterpriseScope
parameter.description: This parameter enables and disables the enterprise-level storage of Open Client Interface (OCI) requests.

parameter.name: groupScope
parameter.description: This parameter enables and disables the group-level storage of Open Client Interface (OCI) requests.

command.name: set
command.description: The command is used to modify an Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) response cache entry.

parameter.name: requestName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) request that has a response that needs to be cached.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: responseName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) response that needs to be cached.

parameter.name: minResponseLengthBytes
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum size of the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) response that is cached (in bytes). Any request smaller than this number will not be cached. This prevents the Open Client Server from caching numerous small Open Client Interface (OCI) responses.

parameter.name: enterpriseScope
parameter.description: This parameter enables and disables the enterprise-level storage of Open Client Interface (OCI) requests.

parameter.name: groupScope
parameter.description: This parameter enables and disables the group-level storage of Open Client Interface (OCI) requests.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) response cache entry.

parameter.name: requestName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) request that has a response that needs to be cached.

context.name: RequestExclusionFilter
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the request exclusion filter entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the request exclusion filter entries.

parameter.name: requestName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) request that has a response that needs to be cached.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a request exclusion filter entry.

parameter.name: requestName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) request that has a response that needs to be cached.

parameter.name: regularExpression
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a regular expression.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing request exclusion filter entry.

parameter.name: requestName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) request that has a response that needs to be cached.

parameter.name: regularExpression
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a regular expression.

context.name: RequestInclusionFilter
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the request inclusion filter entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the request inclusion filter entries.

parameter.name: requestName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) request that has a response that needs to be cached.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a request inclusion filter entry.

parameter.name: requestName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) request that has a response that needs to be cached.

parameter.name: regularExpression
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a regular expression.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a request inclusion filter entry.

parameter.name: requestName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) request that has a response that needs to be cached.

parameter.name: regularExpression
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a regular expression.

context.name: SSLConfiguration
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Open Client Server (OCS)-related attributes. In addition, you can generate a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) key for a secure OCS connection and to load and update a new SSL certificate file.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the available interfaces for the Open Client Server (OCS) with their current Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) configuration.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add the Open Client Server (OCS) with the current Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) configuration properties.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface IP address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: serverCertificate
parameter.description: This parameter dictates if the server presents a certificate for its identity. When the value is set to "true" and the client requests the server identity, the server presents its certificate. When the value is set to "true" but the client does not request the server identity, the server identity is anonymous. When the value is set to "false", the server identity is anonymous.

parameter.name: clientAuthReq
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the server requests the client identity. When the value is set to "true", the server requests the client identity. When the value is set to "false", the server does not request the client identity. When a client receives a request for identity, it shall send its certificate.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Open Client Server (OCS) Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) configuration properties.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface IP address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Name of an attribute to be modified

parameter.name: serverCertificate
parameter.description: This parameter dictates if the server presents a certificate for its identity. When the value is set to "true" and the client requests the server identity, the server presents its certificate. When the value is set to "true" but the client does not request the server identity, the server identity is anonymous. When the value is set to "false", the server identity is anonymous.

parameter.name: clientAuthReq
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the server requests the client identity. When the value is set to "true", the server requests the client identity. When the value is set to "false", the server does not request the client identity. When a client receives a request for identity, it shall send its certificate.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete the Open Client Server (OCS) with the current Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) configuration properties.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface IP address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

command.name: sslExport
command.description: This command is used to export Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) files (certificate, key, or chain file). The SSL file is taken from its location and copied to the ''/var/broadworks/tmp/'' directory.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: Interface IP address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Used to select which file to export.

command.name: sslGenkey
command.description: This command is used to generate an SSL key for a secure OCS. A generated .csr (Certificate Signing Request) file is written to the ''/var/broadworks/tmp'' directory under the name "name.csr", where name is the interface IP address.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This is the Open Client Server (OCS) interface.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Optional attribute to be set.

parameter.name: keyLength
parameter.description: The Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) key length or key size, default value (when not specified) is "1024".

parameter.name: country
parameter.description: The country code internatioal abbrevation code.

parameter.name: stateOrProvince
parameter.description: The state or province.

parameter.name: city
parameter.description: The name of the city.

parameter.name: organisationName
parameter.description: The organization name.

parameter.name: organisationUnit
parameter.description: The organization unit.

parameter.name: emailAddress
parameter.description: The e-mail address.

parameter.name: challengePassword
parameter.description: The challenge password.

parameter.name: commonName
parameter.description: The common name. It must correspond to the host name of this Open Client Server (OCS). A "*" wildcard character may be present in the left-most name component of the host if the certificate is to be used on multiple servers having the same domain. For example, the common name for host xsp1.broadsoft.com could be *.broadsoft.com or xsp*.broadsoft.com.

command.name: sslRemove
command.description: This command is used to remove the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) file (chain file).

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: The Open Client Server (OCS) interface.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The type of file to be removed.

command.name: sslShow
command.description: This command is used to view the details of the X.509 certificate and certificate chain associated with the provided interface. This command reflects the information as it is sent by the server to the software client.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface IP address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

command.name: sslUpdate
command.description: This command is used to load and update a new Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificate file. The certificate is taken from the specified path and copied to the proper location.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: Enter a specific IP address or select ALL.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) configuration attribute to update.

parameter.name: certificateFile
parameter.description: The file name for the certificate file.

parameter.name: keyFile
parameter.description: The file name for the certificate chain file.

parameter.name: chainFile
parameter.description: The file name for the key file.

context.name: ClientAuthentication
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Open Client Server (OCS) client authentication properties.

context.name: Trusts
context.description: This level is used to generate Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) trust anchors.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of Trust Anchors.

command.name: createTrust
command.description: This command is used to generate a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) key and a trust anchor for a secure Open Client Server (OCS) interface.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter describes a name specified by the administrator to identify uniquely a trust anchor.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter describes an optional attribute to be set.

parameter.name: keyLength
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the key length or key size. (default value 2048 when not specified).

parameter.name: country
parameter.description: This parameter describes the country code international abbreviation code.

parameter.name: stateOrProvince
parameter.description: This parameter describes the state or province.

parameter.name: city
parameter.description: This parameter describes the name of the city.

parameter.name: organisationName
parameter.description: This parameter describes the organization name.

parameter.name: organisationUnit
parameter.description: This parameter describes the organization unit.

parameter.name: emailAddress
parameter.description: This parameter describes the e-mail address.

parameter.name: challengePassword
parameter.description: This parameter describes the challenge password.

parameter.name: commonName
parameter.description: This parameter describes the common name. Generally, the common name on a client certificate is the proper name of the organization requesting a certificate. Alternatively, it may follow any standard already determined within the organization owning the certificate.

command.name: deleteTrust
command.description: This command is used to delete a trust anchor identified by its alias name.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter is used to identify which trust anchor to delete.

command.name: exportTrust
command.description: This command is used to export a file related to Secure Sockets Layer (SSL). The SSL file is extracted from the BroadWorks trust store and copied to the /var/broadworks/tmp directory.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter is used to identify which trust anchor to export.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter is used to select which file type to export.

parameter.name: pkcs12File
parameter.description: This parameter indicates to export the certificate and key in a Public-Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS#12) formatted keystore.

parameter.name: pkcs12Password
parameter.description: This parameter is used to specify the password used to secure the Public-Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS#12) formatted keystore.

command.name: showTrust
command.description: This command is used to view the details of the X.509 certificate associated with the trust anchor of the provided interface.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter is used to identify which trust anchor to display.

command.name: updateTrust
command.description: This command is used to load and update a trust anchor file. The certificate is taken from the specified path and copied to the proper location.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter is used to identify which trust anchor to update.

parameter.name: trustAnchorFile
parameter.description: This parameter is used to identify the file name for the trust anchor file.

context.name: WebContainer
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the web container application.

context.name: Apache
context.description: This level is used to configure the Apache container.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to configure the Apache general settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Apache general settings.

command.name: set
command.description: The command is used to modify the Apache general settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: logLevel
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the log level.

parameter.name: maxQueuedConnection
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum length of the queue of pending connections.

parameter.name: usableWorkerThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of configured usable worker threads.

parameter.name: threadsPerWorker
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads created by each child process.

parameter.name: statisticsRefreshPeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the frequency at which BroadWorks fetches PMs from the Apache Web Server.

parameter.name: limitRequestFieldSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the limit (in bytes) on the allowed size of an HTTP request header field.

parameter.name: xFrameOptionsSameOrigin
parameter.description: This parameter enables the addition of the X-Frame-Options HTTP Header (defined by RFC 7034) to all HTTP responses, with a value of "SAMEORIGIN". This is used to improve the protection of web applications against clickjacking.

context.name: WorkersBusyThreshold
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the workers busy threshold settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the workers busy threshold settings.

command.name: set
command.description: The command is used to modify the workers busy threshold settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a threshold is active.

parameter.name: armValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for enabling a threshold crossing.

parameter.name: resetValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for clearing a threshold crossing.

context.name: Tomcat
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Tomcat container.

context.name: Executors
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Tomcat executors.

context.name: AJP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Apache JServ Protocol (AJP) executor.

context.name: Queue
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the queue settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the queue settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the queue settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: capacity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum queue capacity. Tasks are queued while waiting for an available thread. When the value is left unspecified (cleared), queuing is unlimited: tasks are queued as long as there is enough memory available.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) the queue settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

parameter.name: maxQueueSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size of the logging queue.

parameter.name: showThreadName
parameter.description: This parameter enables thread name logging.

context.name: NameService
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the attributes of the Naming Service. The Naming Service defines the interaction of the application with a DNS or local naming solution.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Naming Service peers.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Naming Service-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: cachePolicy
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Cache policy. When this parameter value is set to "HONOR_DNS", the Domain Name System (DNS) client uses the response's ''Time To Live'' (TTL) value.

parameter.name: cacheTTLSecs
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time (in seconds) a successfully looked-up record is cached if the Cache policy is set to "Configured".

parameter.name: negativeCachePolicy
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the negative Cache policy. When this parameter value is set to "HONOR_DNS", the Domain Name System (DNS) client uses the minimum value of the response's Start of Authority (SOA) record.

parameter.name: negativeCacheTTLSecs
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time (in seconds) a looked-up record with a negative response is kept in the negative cache if the negative Cache policy is set to "Configured".

parameter.name: unreachableServerLingerSecs
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum time interval (in seconds) during which no Domain Name System (DNS) request is sent to a server that is detected as unreachable.

parameter.name: useAdditionalSrvRrs
parameter.description: This parameter controls the use of additional Resource Record (RR) sections of the Service Locator (SRV) lookup response. When the value is set to "true", it indicates that an A lookup resulting from SRV lookups uses the pre-resolved A resource records from the additional RR section of the SRV lookup response. Local caching must be enabled for this setting to have an effect.

context.name: Monitoring
context.description: This level is used to view and modify monitoring entries to check the status of the system, troubleshoot issues using logs and audit trails, and review performance and reports.

context.name: Alarm
context.description: This level is used to view and modify alarms. BroadWorks servers trigger alarms and include the ability to obtain and view these alarms. A BroadWorks server alarm can be informational, low severity, medium severity, high severity, or critical severity. Please refer to the application specific fault and alarms Management Information Base (MIB) for a detailed list of alarms.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to get and search for system alarms. These are alarms are located in the local CLI buffer.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: A type of alarm sub-component to filter on.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as a trap type.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: TrapType
parameter.description: This nester parameter determines the trap type. *Use ''notification'' to display the traps at informational purposes. *Use ''alarm'' to display the reporting alarms. *Use ''software error'' to display the software errors.

parameter.name: trapName
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as a trap name.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the trap name.

parameter.name: problem
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as problem text.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: ProblemText
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a text element that may represent an actual trap text (partially or entirely).

parameter.name: subcomp
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as a BroadWorks software component or area.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Subcomponent
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the software component within the BroadWorks entity that is reporting the alarm: "SIP", "database", and so on. Refer to the BroadWorks fault MIBs for a list valid sub-components.

parameter.name: recommendation
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as recommendation text.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: RecommendationText
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a text element that may represent an actual trap recommended action text (partially or entirely).

parameter.name: state
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter is based on the state of an alarm.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: AlarmState
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the state of an alarm.

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter based on the trap generation time. The acceptable time formats are as follow: * MM/DD/YY hh:mm AM|PM * MM/DD/YY

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the date and time the alarm was generated.

parameter.name: comp
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as an entity reporting the alarm.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Component
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the BroadWorks entity reporting the alarm. Refer to the BroadWorks fault MIBs for a list valid entities.

parameter.name: sysname
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as the system name.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: SystemName
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the host name of the system running the BroadWorks software.

parameter.name: trapSeverity
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter based on alarm severity.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Severity
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the severity. *"Informational Warning": no immediate problems. *"Low": minor problem with a possible service impact. *"Medium": minor problem with a minor service impact. *"High": major problem with a major service impact. *"Critical": emergency system outage.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter based on alarm ID.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Identifier
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a sequentially generated number that is used to uniquely identify the alarm.

parameter.name: back
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a report based on the last N alarms.

parameter.name: numAlarms
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of alarms to move back.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to view and modify the size of the CLI buffer for alarms. The recommended buffer size is "1,000" alarms.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: localsize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the local alarms backlog size (in number of alarms). Note that , alarms are searched and displayed by accessing the local backlog and not the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) agent's backlog. This parameter returns to its default value ("1000") for each new CLI session.

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the SNMP agent alarms backlog size (in number of alarms). The SNMP agent backlog size determines how many alarms are stored in memory and (optionally) on disk and represents the maximum number of alarms that can be retrieved by CLI clients. When the actual number of historical alarms overflows the ''size''parameter, the oldest alarms are deleted. The''localsize''is limited by the ''size''.

parameter.name: logging
parameter.description: This parameter turns logging on and off. When the values is "false", logging to disk is turned off. Logging to disk allows alarms to be persisted across SNMP agent restarts. When the value is "true", logging to disk is turned on. Logging to disk allows alarms to be persisted across SNMP agent restarts.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to delete alarms from the local CLI backlog buffer, from the SNMP agent backlog buffer, and from disk.

command.name: ShowConfig
command.description: This command is used to display the alarm-related configuration.

command.name: close
command.description: This command is used to close the connection with the SNMP agent, which is used to obtain system alarms and event logs generated by the BroadWorks Server.

command.name: open
command.description: This command is used to open a connection with the SNMP agent to obtain system alarms and event logs generated by the BroadWorks Server. When opening system alarms, the port to be used is specified. If a port is not specified the agent default is used.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port used to communicate with the SNMP agent. When not specified the agent default is used.

command.name: show
command.description: This command is used to enable or disable real-time alarm echoing. When real-time alarm echoing is enabled, alarms display at the CLI as they occur. When alarms occur, they appear in the window from which this command was invoked. To avoid interrupting other BroadWorks Server CLI commands, open a separate window.

parameter.name: onoff
parameter.description: This parameter enables the alarm show funtion. The ''on'' option enables the alarm show function. The ''off'' option disables the alarm show function.

context.name: AlarmsTable
context.description: This level is used to clear a specific active alarm, clear all active alarms, list currently active alarms, resend an active alarm, and resend all active alarms. When an alarm is raised, its state is set to "On". When an alarm is resolved and cleared by the server, its state is set to "Off". When an alarm is manually cleared, its state is set to "Cleared". "Off" and "Cleared" alarms are equivalent; however, a "Cleared" alarm indicates that the alarm was cleared manually.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear an alarm.

parameter.name: identifier
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the identifier of the alarm to resend.

command.name: clearAll
command.description: This command is used to clear all active alarms.

command.name: list
command.description: This command is used to display the list of currently active alarms.

command.name: resend
command.description: This command is used to resend a currently active alarm to a remote host.

parameter.name: identifier
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the identifier of the alarm to be resent.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the remote host that the alarm is sent to.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number of the remote host.

command.name: resendAll
command.description: This command is used to resend all currently active alarms to a remote host.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the remote host that the alarm is sent to.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number of the remote host.

context.name: Threshold
context.description: This level is used to define thresholds against alarms defined for the BroadWorks Server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view a list of the alarm thresholds defined on the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new threshold against an alarm defined in the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

parameter.name: maxNumTrapsPerTimePeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of traps for the time period.

parameter.name: timePeriodInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time period (in seconds).

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the alarm is active or inactive.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Note that problem text variables can be defined.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable1
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable2
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable3
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable4
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable5
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify a threshold against an alarm defined in the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the index number.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Note that problem text variables can be defined.

parameter.name: maxNumTrapsPerTimePeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of traps for the time period.

parameter.name: timePeriodInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time period (in seconds).

parameter.name: problemTextVariable1
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable2
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable3
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable4
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable5
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the alarm is active or inactive.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing alarm threshold.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the index number.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear all alarm threshold attributes.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the index number.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Note that problem text variables can be defined.

context.name: Default
context.description: This level is used to set the system default alarm threshold attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the system default alarm threshold attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the system default alarm threshold attributes defined on the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: maxNumTrapsPerTimePeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of traps for the time period.

parameter.name: timePeriodInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time period (in seconds).

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the attribute is active or inactive.

parameter.name: minSeverity
parameter.description: This parameter determines the severity level. Valid values include: "informational", "low", "medium", "high", and "critical".

context.name: PM
context.description: This level is used to navigate and view the values of the Management Information Base (MIB) nodes. Performance Measurements (PMs) are used to monitor the BroadWorks server performance, as well as, the operating system and hardware performance. To simplify navigation, PMs are organized in a tree structure.

context.name: BWCallCenter
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Performance Measurements (PMs) of the BWCallCenter

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Management Information Base (MIB) node values. MIB node values can be viewed in the following ways: All performance measurements throughout the MIB nodes tree structure. Performance measurements related to the current node. Performance measurements of a specified path.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter displays Performance Measurements (PMs). Use the "-r" option to display all PMs for the current tree structure of the Management Information Base (MIB) nodes. Use the "-f" option to display a full description of PMs.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the path of the node of the Performance Measurements (PMs) to view.

parameter.name: tableKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value of a row key for a node (to display as a table).

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify a Management Information Base (MIB) node values.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Use the ''counter'' option to set a scalar entry in a MIB (outside of a table). Use the ''table'' option to set a value in a table.

parameter.name: counter
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value of an individual counter.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of a node in the Management Information Base (MIB).

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the value of a counter.

parameter.name: table
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value of the table, column, row, or table entry.

parameter.name: tableName
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of a table in the Management Information Base (MIB).

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the options. Use the "all" option to set all writable values in a table at once. Use the "column" option to set all the writable values of a specific column in a table. Use the "row" option to set all the writable values of a specific row in a table. Use the "entry" option to set a specific entry in a table; specifying the row and column.

parameter.name: all
parameter.description: This parameter specifies all of the values in a table.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the value of a counter.

parameter.name: column
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the values of a specific column in a table.

parameter.name: columnName
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of a column.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the value of a counter.

parameter.name: row
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the values of a specific row in a table.

parameter.name: rowKey
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the value of a row index or key.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the value of a counter.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the values of a specific entry (row and column) in a table.

parameter.name: columnName
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of a column.

parameter.name: rowKey
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the value of a row index or key.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the value of a counter.

command.name: cd
command.description: This command is used to navigate through the BroadWorks server Management Information Base (MIB) nodes in a manner similar to the standard''cd''(change directory) command. Use the ''/''parameter to navigate back to the root. Use the ''..''parameter to go back one level.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: A CLI context path.

command.name: ls
command.description: This command is used to view the next BroadWorks server Management Information Base (MIB) nodes in a manner similar to the standard''ls''(list) command.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter determines the options. Use the "-r" option to show the tree structure of the Management Information Base (MIB) nodes. Use the "-n" option to show the name of the nodes containing values.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the path to the node.

command.name: pwd
command.description: This command is used to view the current position in the BroadWorks server Management Information Base (MIB) in a manner similar to the standard''pwd''(present working directory) command.
